Aubrie_Sellers:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter (born 1991)}} {{BLP sources|date=January 2016}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Aubrie Sellers | birth_name = Aubrie Lee Sellers | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1991|02|12}}{{cite web|url=https://www.astro.com/astro-databank/Sellers,_Aubrie|title=Sellers, Aubrie|date=August 8, 2016|accessdate=December 10, 2017}} | birth_place = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar}} | genre = [[Alternative country]] | occupation = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter|musician}} | years_active = 2015–present | label = [[Warner Music Nashville]] | website = {{URL|http://www.aubriesellers.com/}} }} '''Aubrie Lee Sellers''' (born February 12, 1991) is an American country music singer, songwriter, and musician. She is the daughter of singer/songwriters [[Jason Sellers]] and [[Lee Ann Womack]]; and the stepdaughter of music producer [[Frank Liddell]]. Sellers's debut album, ''New City Blues'', was released on January 29, 2016, through [[Carnival Music]]. Many of the songs on ''New City Blues'' were co-written with Adam Wright.from an interview on [https://americanamusicshow.com/episode297 Americana Music Show #297], published April 26, 2016. She was featured on [[Ralph Stanley|Dr. Ralph's]] 2015 album, ''Ralph Stanley and Friends: A Man of Constant Sorrow'', where she sang “White Dove” with her mother, Lee Ann Womack.{{cite web|url=http://www.countryweekly.com/music/whos-new-aubrie-sellers|title=Who's New: Aubrie Sellers|work=Country Weekly}} ==Influences== Sellers has cited numerous musical influences that reach across genres: [[The Kinks]], [[Screamin' Jay Hawkins]], Buddy and Julie Miller, [[Creedence Clearwater Revival]], [[Ricky Skaggs]], [[Patty Griffin]], [[Neil Young]], [[Bob Dylan]], Ralph Stanley and [[Led Zeppelin]].{{cite web|url=https://opry.com/artist/aubrie-sellers#sthash.tO6oXSK9.dpuf|title=Aubrie Sellers:Artist bio|work=Grand Ole Opry}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Album details ! colspan="3"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:9em;"| Sales |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! style="width:45px;"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]
